fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you insert a link that contains umlaut or cyrillic characters via {{Insert more content > Link > Web link}} or the shortcuts {{⌘+K}} / {{CTRL+K}}, the link changes so that Confluence encodes the percentage (%) symbol as {{%25}}. This renders the link to be unusable.

For example:
 # Correct link inserted into a Confluence page: [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Die_L%C3%B6wen]
 # Incorrect link after saving the page and clicking on the link: [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Die_L%25C3%25B6wen]

You can see the % symbol in the original link has been replaced as {{%25}}.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Option 1
 # Create a new page and insert a web link via one of the methods below:
 ** {{Insert more content > Link > Web link}}
 ** {{⌘+K}} / {{CTRL+K}}
 # Insert this URL into the 'Address' field: [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Die_L%C3%B6wen]
 # Insert any text into the the 'Link text' field.
 # Click on "Insert".
 # Save the page.
 # Try to open the link.

Option 2
 # Create a new page and paste a web link
 # Edit the link and see that the 'Address' and 'Link text' field have not changed
 # Change the 'Link text' field to new text
 # Save the link
 # Edit the link again
 # The URL in the 'Address' field has now been changed

h3. Expected Results

The link on the page should direct you to the correct page: [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Die_L%C3%B6wen]
h3. Actual Results

The link directs you to an invalid page: [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Die_L%25C3%25B6wen]
h3. Notes

Tested in Confluence 5.9.14. The functionality works as expected
h3. Workaround

-Option 1: Replace all {{%}} signs in links with spaces instead-
 # -Take: {{[https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Die_L%C3%B6wen]}} URL-
 # -Change to: {{[https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Die_L] C3 B6wen}}-

Option 1: Paste the link into the editor instead of using insert link dialog.
 * In this method you cannot modify the link text, so the link text will be automatically set based on the url

Option 2: Use square brackets to insert the link. [ ]
 # Type "["
 # Type the text you want for your link in the editor, for example "My Link"
 # Type a "|"
 # *Type* the url
 # Type "]" to complete the link.
 # Save or preview the page to confirm it works.
 # *Important!* Don't open the link dialog for this link. If you do, the link will be double-encoded.

For step 4, you could also try pasting the url but this might have less success since the url will be converted to a link automatically and you might have to first undo that automatic conversion, which in turn may cause the closing "]" to have no effect. See option 3 instead.

Option 3
 # Paste the URL into the editor.
 # Press undo to undo any automatic link creation/extraction so you see the original URL.
 # If the URL is still a link, click it, and click "Unlink" to return it back to regular text.
 # At the beginning of the link, type [ followed by `Escape` to exit the Link Autocomplete
 # Type the text to display for the link followed by "|"
 # Now your link should look like this
 ## !Screen Shot 2017-05-11 at 7.37.39 AM.png|width=379,height=48!
 # Click at the end of the link and type "]" to complete the link. This should auto-convert it to a link with the desired text.
 # Save or preview the page to confirm it works.
 # *Important!* Don't open the link dialog for this link. If you do, the link will be double-encoded.

 

Option 4: Using the Source Editor to change links after adding them
 # Install the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] (free add-on)
 # Edit the page
 # Click on the {{<>}} icon in the top right
 # Find the *href=* attribute that contains the '%25' in the URL
 # Replace it with just '%'
 # Apply the changes and save the page
fields.summary: Links containing umlaut or cyrillic characters become invalid
On sharing a page, keep own notes for later re-use
SNI is not working as expected in in Confluence 6.0.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45961].
  {panel}

As a confluence editor I would like to link to specific table rows (for tables which include a numbering column), so that I can reference them with a permanent link, and so that my references do not break as I add and remove rows.

Motivation:

When I create a table with numbering column, I may wish to reference specific rows. If I reference them by number, then make any significant changes, all my references are semantically broken.

Adding a unique permalink to each number in the numbering row would allow me to reference rows using a consistent ID, and preserve references regardless of further editing.
fields.summary: Add permalink anchors to numbers in table numbering column

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45959].
  {panel}

During a Confluence installation, the wizard gives you the option to add two spaces:
 * A demostration space
 * The admin user is forced to create a space at the end of the installation wizard

The default space permissions for those spaces allow anonymous users to create all types of content in those spaces. If anonymous access is later enabled at a global level, those spaces will be vulnerable to spam. By default, permissions to anonymous user should be a lot more restrictive (view only).
fields.summary: Restrict demonstration and default space anonymous permissions
JIRA charts (in Confluence) should use consistent or customizable colors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45924].
  {panel}

h3. Problem definition:
When you create a JIRA macro and put in a search filter, you are not allowed to hit insert until you hit the search button. When you update an existing JIRA macro's search filter, the tool does not stop you from hitting the Insert button if you have not hit the search button.
If you update an existing JIRA macro's search filter and hit the Insert button without hitting the search button first, the changes are not retained, however, If you update an existing JIRA macro's search filter and first hit the search button followed by the Insert button, the changes ARE retained.

h3. Suggestion:
Thus, this can cause confusion between the users. Make the Insert button be disabled until the search button is clicked when the search filter criteria is edited in the same way as it is disabled when initially creating a new JIRA macro so that people do not fall into the same "trap" or insert a warning that if they hit Insert without searching before, it will not update the filter.
fields.summary: Editing a JIRA Macro does not save
Columns misaligned when they are inside a section

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you enable Collaborative Editing in Confluence 6.x and create two blog posts with identical titles in the same space (whether they're created on the same day or not), Confluence throws an error message saying:
{quote}A page with the title 'blog 1' already exists in this space. Enter a different title for your page.{quote}

In short, this means the behaviour with Collaborative Editing turned on is as such:
# Two blog posts with identical titles set for the same day cannot be saved.
# Two blog posts with identical titles set for different days cannot be saved.

The behaviour is different with Collaborative Editing turned off / in Confluence 5.x, whereby the results are as such:
# Two blog posts with identical titles set for the same day cannot be saved.
# Two blog posts with identical titles set for different days *can* be saved.

This change is not mentioned anywhere in the [Confluence 6.0 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-0-release-notes-844235309.html].

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install Confluence 6.0.4.
# Create a space.
# Create a new blog post for January 20, 2017 titled 'blog 1' and save it.
# Create another blog post for January 3, 2017 titled 'blog 1' and save it.

h3. Expected Results
The second blog post can be saved.

h3. Actual Results
The second blog post can't be saved with the following error:

 !Screen Shot 2017-01-26 at 9.57.15 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Blog post titles for different dates within the same space must be unique if Collaborative Editing is enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45920].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

JavaScript or dynamic customizations are not rendered in PDF Exports. This is probably a limitation of the PDF box library, where only the static HTML and CSS code is rendered in exported PDFs.

h3. Suggested Solution

Confluence could execute any dynamic code before the PDF is exported.

h3. Why this is important

This would be useful for customers that want to add the current date or any other dynamic content in exported documents.

h3. Workaround

Since only HTML code is rendered, the workaround is to hardcode the date which could be dynamically set by a JavaScript function.
fields.summary: JavaScript Code Should be Rendered in PDF Exports

fields.description:
h5. Steps To Replicate :
 # Export a backup from cloud
 # Import into Confluence Server
 # Generate a support zip
 # Check *application.xml* file
 # Search for <server.base.url> in the xml file
 # The server base url becomes N/A
{code:java}
<server.base.url>N/A</server.base.url>
{code}

h5. Workaround
 # Log in Confluence as a system administrator
 # !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/703398523/Cog.png?version=1&modificationDate=1421718696855&api=v2! > General Configuration
 # Select *Edit*
 # Ensure Server Base URL is displayed correctly in the text field
 # Save

or follow the steps in
* [How Do I replace all 'hard' links to my old Base URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-do-i-replace-all-hard-links-to-my-old-base-url-284366235.html]

to make the changes.

Note : Due to this issue, it may prevent synchrony from working properly right after the restoration.
fields.summary: Server Base URL becomes N/A after restoring from a Cloud backup.
Healthcheck plugin should include checking the performance of Synchrony
Option to increase size of the characters in page edition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45913].
  {panel}

Many macros have the option to hide the title, but this one does not.  

Often my pages may have colored titles or a certain look.  By forcing the built in title my look and feel is compromised.

Also it uses the European spelling :)

 

Update: This should honestly be a standard setting for all built-in content macros.  Here are samples of two different macros, both with different styled headers that cannot be disabled.  I have included samples of the respective heading styles used.

 

!image-2017-01-25-08-53-47-024.png!

!image-2017-01-25-08-53-59-992.png!
fields.summary: Standardize headings/titles for built-in content macros, provide option to hide.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45912].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

In Confluence Cloud we are not able to use custom HTML due to restricted functions to remove the Atlassian Top bar where we can see the People and Spaces tab neither the application navigator links for public access.

Also, no links to any other objects and the potential to hide the sidebar would be appreaciated.

Only some of the application navigator links are possible to be removed, but links for JIRA and Bitbucket integrated with Cloud environment are not possible to be removed.

h3. Solution

Add an option to remove the top bar and all the application navigator links.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Remove the top bar and application navigator for anonymous users

fields.description:
Description
In the [Upgrading Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/upgrading-confluence-4578.html] documentation, it stated that the CATALINA_OPTS or JAVA_OPTS parameters in your setenv.sh / setenv.bat will be migrated during the upgrade process.

However, as per this [suggestion ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28085], the CATALINA_OPTS parameter will not be migrated. As the result of testing, the CATALINA_OPTS parameter does not migrate during the upgrade process from confluence 5.6.3. to 5.10.8. This could cause confusion to the customer.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Install Confluence 5.6.3
# Edit the setenv file and increase the memory to 2048.
# Add the following parameter in the CATALINA_OPTS section
{code}
-Dconfluence.upgrade.recovery.file.enabled=false
{code}
# Save the file
# Run confluence 5.10.8 installer and perform an upgrade
# Open the setenv file
# The modification was removed and reset to default.
fields.summary: Correction in confluence upgrade documentation
Confluence throws "Comparison method violates its general contract!" when trying to sort multiple long-running tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Exporting a Space, in the progress there is a link to view the Long Running Tasks {{<base-url>/admin/longrunningtask.action}}
This page throws an error everytime it is opened and never shows any content.


h3. Environment
Confluence 5.8, 5.10 and 6.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to Confluence
# Open the following URL {{<base-url>/admin/longrunningtask.action}}


h3. Expected Results
The page would open showing Long Running Tasks currently active in Confluence


h3. Actual Results
The page opens displaying the following error
 !longrunningtask-error-ui.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No available workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Long Running Task admin page displays an error
The date macro can provide a direct input field to shorten the effort required to capture a date in the far future or past.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Drafts are not viewable under drafts.
h3. Environment
Any

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page.
# Edit the page.
# Save Draft.
# Look under drafts and see no drafts present.

h3. Expected Results
Would expect drafts to show up in the designated area.
h3. Actual Results
No Drafts show up in the drafts area.
h3.Workaround
No workaround found.
Create a page and then edit the page and save the draft. Click on your profile picture and select drafts you will see no drafts found despite creating a draft.
fields.summary: Drafts not viewable under drafts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45898].
  {panel}

h4. Summary 

URLs should be based on pageID instead of pageTitle
By default, a confluence URL contains the space and page title. 
eg: [http://confluence.mydomain.org:8090/display/KEY/Page+Title+Goes+Here] 
When the page is renamed or moved to another location, the URL changes.
This behaviour is not ideal / wanted.

h4. Actual Behaviour
When a task is created, or somebody is mentioned, an e-mail notification is sent.
When a page title or location changes afterward, the e-mail link is broken.
The same goes of course for bookmarks.
This is frustrating for people as in a lot of cases, pages are being renamed / moved frequently.

h4. Expected Behaviour
Confluence supports URLs based on the fixed page ID, which would overcome the above issue.
eg; [http://confluence.mydomain.org:8090/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=12345]
(if a page title contains non-ascii character, the URL is automatically based on pageID).
However, I cannot find a way to setup pageID urls by default.

For manual copy/paste sharing, we promote the "Link to this page" feature.
Unfortunately, most mail references to confluence are generated by the system.
What strikes me is that at the bottom of a generated mail, you have the links "view page", "comment" and "like". 
"View page" and "comment" use to the standard link. However "like" uses the pageID link.
fields.summary: URLs should be based on pageID instead of pageTitle
Allow Confluence Cloud new UI to show child page on the UI whenever wanted

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Inside [https://translations.atlassian.com|https://translations.atlassian.com/] translation packs are missing for Confluence releases from 5.10.0 to 6.0.4.
h3. Environment
 * [https://translations.atlassian.com|https://translations.atlassian.com/]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to [https://translations.atlassian.com|https://translations.atlassian.com/]
 # Pick for example German language and downloads.
 # Then pick Confluence as product
 # You will not be able to find versions from 5.10.0 to 6.0.4 in the versions dropdown menu.

h3. Expected Results

In dropdown menu for Version ability to select the version from 5.10.0 to 6.0.4.
h3. Actual Results

Missing versions.
fields.summary: Missing release version translation pack.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a specific space is configured for the Site Banner/[Site Homepage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Site+Home+Page], JIRA Service Desk users with viewing access (rather than full licenses) cannot use the site banner to return to the designated space and instead receive a Not Permitted error. The URL for the banner points to the base URL and is looking for a redirect.


h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk with Users with Viewing access to Confluence only


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Confluence and JIRA Service Desk together
# [Create a KB space for JSD|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html]
# Change the [Confluence site homepage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Site+Home+Page] (which will change the banner link as well) to the KB space
# Sign in as a JSD user
# Go to the KB space via JIRA, which should be successful
# Click the banner at the top to return to the home page of the KB space

h3. Expected Results
The JIRA Service Desk user is able to click on the Confluence banner at the top and go to the designated Space

h3. Actual Results
The link only goes to the base URL for Confluence as it is expecting information on what the user may have configured as the home page, but the user is not a fully licensed user and receives a "Not Permitted" error

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Site Homepage redirection does not work for JIRA Service Desk users
Outgoing Email Statistic Report
Rest api doesn't work when page title starts with a number

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence does not download Confluence Questions metadata, so it won't display log analyser results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Execute log scanner on a file that has matching Confluence Questions data, e.g.: https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/179443532/confluencequestions_regex_v2.xml

h3. Expected Results

Results are returned.

h3. Actual Results

They're not.
fields.summary: Support Tools Plugin is missing RegEx for Confluence Questions

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Users that's accessing Confluence with computers that has non-round timezones (like UTC +9:30) are not seeing correct timestamps in their "Recently Worked On" page in the dashboard

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set the Confluence server timezone to UTC-5
# Set a *client*/user computer time zone to any non-round amount of hours and positively shifted from UTC; for example UTC+9:30 Darwin
# Access Confluence and Edit a document.
# Document shows "Created by USER, last modified just a moment ago".
# Open Dashboard, "Recently worked on" shows modified "Yesterday".
# Set computer time zone to any with round amount of hours and shifted from UTC in any direction; for example UTC+10 Brisbane.
# Refresh "Recently worked on" — now it will properly display edited page under "Today".

Screencast attached to this bug report: [^Recording #15.avi] 



h3. Expected Results
* Edited page should be displayed under in "Recently worked on" section under "Today" regardless of the time zone settings.

h3. Notes 
- Index rebuild from scratch doesn't help
- Time zone in user's profile is irrelevant.
- This issue does not exist for *negative shifted zones*, (for example, UTC -9:30 and UTC -3:30)

This issue can also be replicated with timezones that are very close to each other such as:
|| Server Timezone | GMT+8 (Kuala Lumpur, Singapore) |
|| Browsing Client Timezone | GMT+8.45 (Eucla) |
(i) This doesn't seem to be due to _how big is the gap_ between 2 timezones, but the mismatch of the minute difference


This issue is important for Confluence with users from different timezones.
This can cause confusion among users.
fields.summary: Recently worked on dashboard showing incorrect timestamps when clients do not have round amount Time Zones

fields.description:
*STEP TO REPRODUCE THE ISSUE*
# Create a page template in a Confluence Space.
# Insert a *Code Block Macro* in the template.
# Insert a variable (exp: $author) in the Code Block Macro.
# Save the template.
# Create a page using the template.
# Save the page.

*EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR*
The variable exists in the Code Block Macro.

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR*
The variable disappears in the Code Block Macro.
fields.summary: Variable inside Confluence Code Block Macro in a page template disappear after the page created from the template saved.

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
While creating template in Confluence, position of variables set will move to next line, if being placed in the same line as a preformatted texts

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Space Template by going to Space Tools > Content Tools > Templates > Create a new template
# Add a text and a variable in the same line:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Change the format of this line to preformatted
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Save the template
# Edit the template back again

h3. Expected Results
Still the same as how the template was saved

h3. Actual Results 
The variable has moved to the next line:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround 
Do not use preformatted formatting when having variables in the template
fields.summary: Variables in a template will be sent to next line if located the same line as a preformatted text

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45858].
  {panel}

Hi,

Could you please tell us how to make Page Properties Report Macro work with third-party add-on? Should the add-on implement any interface to interact with Page Properties Report? Or maybe it is a bug in Page Properties Report?

We have the first page with multiexcerpt:

!image-2017-01-21-13-55-17-869.png!

We have the second page with properties and multiexcert include:

!image-2017-01-21-13-56-21-085.png!

Here is the second page view mode:

!image-2017-01-21-13-56-56-459.png!

But when we use Page Properties report on the third page the property value is empty:

!image-2017-01-21-13-58-37-146.png!
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro Integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom titles for the Expand Macro should be searchable when editing pages. This would be very useful in situations where the macros hold high amounts of content and the page has numerous Expands. This results in a difficult process of finding a specific macro as the user needs to scroll down the page and manually search for it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page
 # Add an Expand Macro
 # Change its title
 # Search for the title using Ctrl + f or Cmd + f

h3. Expected Results

Expand macro titles are searchable.

h3. Actual Results

Expand macro titles are not searchable, results are empty.

h3. Notes

When inspecting the macro, we can see that it is rendered as a CSS background image in the Editor. The macro title could be rendered as Text in order to be searchable. 

Another option would be to scan the Table that holds the macro and search for the parameter 'data-macro-parameters="title..."'.

h3. Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: Expand Macro Custom Titles are not Searchable in Edit Mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inserting Markdown (header) with a whitespace at the end results in an error below:
{code}Wiki markup conversion errors
error : Internal Server Error{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence
# Click on the *Insert More Content* button and select *{ } Markup* from the list.
# Select *Markdown* from the dropdown box and then paste the following text into the Insert field:
{noformat}
# Test Header 
{noformat}
(!) Please do take note that there's a whitespace at the end of the word Header
# Click Insert

h3. Expected Results
Header is inserted successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The following errors are then shown in {{<Confluence-Home>/logs/atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{code}
2017-01-19 10:56:15,542 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: String index out of range
: 16
 -- referer: http://10.60.3.54:8090/pages/editpage.action?pageId=3899412 | url: /rest/tinymce/1/markdownxhtmlconverter | traceId: 36589fca65244415 | userName: admin
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 16
        at java.lang.String.charAt(String.java:646)
        at com.sangupta.nutz.TextLine.charAt(TextLine.java:256)
        at com.sangupta.nutz.Parser.parseHeading(Parser.java:626)
        at com.sangupta.nutz.Parser.parseLine(Parser.java:222)
        at com.sangupta.nutz.Parser.readLines(Parser.java:192)
        at com.sangupta.nutz.Parser.parse(Parser.java:137)
        at com.sangupta.nutz.MarkdownProcessor.toHtml(MarkdownProcessor.java:97)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.tinymceplugin.rest.MarkdownXhtmlConverter.convert(MarkdownXhtmlConverter.java:54)
{code}
fields.summary: Extra Whitespace in Markdown Resulted in Error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to export the page's titles only. It must export all the spaces to acquire the full list of pages.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a custom export that would allow to select if the customer wants to download the title only with or without the content.
fields.summary: Export page titles only

fields.description:
h6. Steps to reproduce:
 # Allow Public Access to Confluence
 # Check the Page with Mobile Browsers
 # It asks for authentication

h6. Expected Behaviour

It shouldn't ask for authentication since it's public.
h6. Actual Behaviour

Confluence ask for username and password 
h4. Note:

I couldn't replicate this issue in Confluence 6.0.3
fields.summary: Public pages prompting for authentication in Mobile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45825].
  {panel}

h6. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a Page in *Firefox browser running on Windows*
 # Add two sections to the page.
 # In one section add a table.
 # Select the table and copy it.
 # Try to paste it on the other section.

h6. Expected Behaviour
Table should copy to the other section

h6. actual behaviour
Table breaks when you paste it in the other section.

h4. Note:
* This issue also affect copy and pasting table from *Microsoft Excel* file.
* This issue happens in *Firefox on Windows* only and you can't replicate it in Chrome or Edge in Windows and other OS.
fields.summary: Copy and paste tables into a page section in Firefox on Windows breaks the table formatting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45824].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence user and project admin, it would be good to have Portfolio Scope and the Gantt like structure available on it on Confluence pages.
h3. Suggested Solution
Create a dedicated macro to hold the data and present it for the end user.
fields.summary: Improve integration between Portfolio and Confluence
Display the full modified date (including hour) on the attachment makro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Saved page Data Format is difference from the system date format.

Confluence is running with the non-English system locale. like: ja
 A user changes his date format to "dd/MMM/yyyy".
 the user inputs a date with date picker. "17 Jan 2017".
 And save the page, then the date format is changed to "17 01 2017"
h3. Environment
 * System language: *ja*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User Profile => Settings -> Edit
 # Change Language to English
 # Confluence administration -> General Configuration -> Formatting and International Settings -> Edit
 # Change Date Format to *dd/MMM/yyyy*
 # Save
 # Create a new page. and input a date with // ex. "*17 Jan 2017*"
 # Save. and then the page date format is changed. ex "*17 01 2017*"

h3. Expected Results

Both before saving date format and after saving date format are the same format.
h3. Actual Results

Both before saving date format and after saving date format are different date format.
h3. Workaround

Add an option {{-Duser.language=en}} to {{CATALINA_OPTS}} in setenv.sh
{code:java}
  CATALINA_OPTS="-Duser.language=en ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
{code}
fields.summary: Saved page Data Format is difference from the system date format.
My admin rights is not working. Kindly do the needful.
Page history shows only avatars not usernames

fields.description: The com.atlassian.confluence.diff.TDM has a newer version 0.10.2.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45815].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Paste PDF into the editor from clipboard using Chrome does not work.

h3. Environment

* Confluence 1000.847.1 (Cloud), Confluence 6.0.3 (Server)
* Chrome 55.0.2883.95
* macOS Sierra

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h4. Scenario1
# Copy a PDF file in Finder.app
# Open a Confluence page in edit mode
# Press {{Cmd + V}} in the Confluence page

h4. Scenario2
# Open Terminal.app
# Execute the following commands
{code}
$ defaults write com.apple.screencapture type pdf
$ killall SystemUIServer
{code}
# Press {{Command + Control + Shift + 3}} to capture a screenshot into the clipboard
# Open a Confluence page in edit mode
# Press {{Cmd + C}} in the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results

The paste from the clipboard should work correctly in the both scenario.

h3. Actual Results

h4. Scenario1

The PDF wasn't attached to the page and the filename is just pasted as a text.

h4. Scenario2

The paste failed silently.
If we monitor the step in developer tools, we can see the following JavaScript error.

{code}
dollar.js:1 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'size' of null
    at Object.pasteFromEvent (dollar.js:1)
    at Object.onPaste (dollar.js:1)
    at Editor.<anonymous> (dollar.js:1)
    at Dispatcher.dispatch (dollar.js:1)
    at b (dollar.js:1)
    at DOMUtils.<anonymous> (dollar.js:1)
    at HTMLBodyElement.e (dollar.js:1)
{code}

When it comes to some of third-party apps, they try to store images as PDF when copying them into clipboard.
That's why these scenario should be also considered.

h3. Notes

This problem might be caused by [this browser's spec|https://w3c.github.io/clipboard-apis/#reading-from-clipboard].
Even though we don't support pasting PDF from clipboard, it would be more user friendly if Confluence could show some error on the UI.

h3.Workaround

Use the other browsers instead.
fields.summary: Paste PDF into the editor from clipboard using Chrome does not work

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45790].
  {panel}

Hello,

i want to display a "Related Pages Box", which is created automatically. and is in relationship with the title or content of a page. The sense of the "Related Pages Box" is to show the reader, which pages could be still interesting him.

Like the navigation map macro but it should be created automatically without labels.

The best way would be to display the search results as a list on a page.

It would be great, if it list all related attachment or comments too.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45786].
  {panel}

*STEP TO REPLICATE*
 # Create a new page in Confluence.
 # Insert HTML Include Macro.
 # Insert the link to external XML file with XSL transformation.
 # Save the page.

 

*EXPECTED RESULT*

Confluence will display the file.

 

*ACTUAL RESULT*

An ERROR message appear in the mcro preview:

*Unable to retrieve <<URL-TO-THE-XmlFile.xml>> - The page can not be found.*

 

*NOTE*

Confluence HTML Include Macro haven't support the feature to render links to an external XML file containing XSL transformation. Therefore, it would be much convenience if we could have this feature implemented in the future release.
fields.summary: Confluence Feature to include link to XML files with XSL transformation in HTML Include Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45785].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently, Table of Content macro (TOC macro) will only display summary of contents that are inside a page. 

This is true even when the TOC macro is placed inside the comment section, where the TOC macro will still shows summary of content that's inside the page, and not the summary of content that's inside the comment section.

h3. suggestion:
Update the documentation that the TOC macro will generate Table of Content based on the content inside the page, regardless on whether its being placed in a comment section or inside the page itself:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf51/table-of-contents-macro-336169370.html
fields.summary: Update the Table of Content Documentation that TOC table is for pages only
Add Trello macro to Confluence so that Trello boards can be displayed within Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45777].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When setting a file attachment on a page to [*show as link* instead of *show as thumbnail*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/display-files-and-images-245827130.html#DisplayFilesandImages-Insertafileintoyourpage], the link opens the preview panel, rather than going straight to direct download.

# Currently, you need to preview the file first, then click the download arrow in the top right.
 !Download Button.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
# Add an option to list a file as a link for download, not just to list the link.
# Or add the option to open or preview the file when clicking a text link to an attachment.

h3. Workarounds
*Workaround 1: Middle Click*
# You can middle-click the text link and a download Window should open
#* If you do not have the middle click option on your mouse, you can hold ctrl (Windows) or command (Mac) and then left-click the link with your mouse

*Workaround 2: Right-click to "Save as"*
# Set your file to *show as link* when inserting it to the page in the editor
# Right-click the file link on the page when viewing the page
# Click your browser's version of the *Save as* functionality
# The file will be saved rather than previewed
fields.summary: When showing attachment as a link, offer option for direct file download
Make Confluence Personal space show assigned JIRA issues by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45774].
  {panel}

The usefulness of the existing capability to filter which content is displayed in an activity stream would be greatly enhanced by providing the ability to exclude specific labels.

This might be generically implemented by exposing a micro-language providing for boolean combinations to be expressed.

If you continue to use "a,b" to mean "a or b", you could use space to mean 'and', and "-" to mean not.

then "(a, b) - c" would select activity on content labeled a or b, but not c.

My specific use case is for a space which primarily manages a particular (page) content type that I want to highlight in its own activity stream.  I can do this using the label filter. However, I want another activity stream for changes in the space to all other content.  This would be made easily possible if you implement my request.
fields.summary: Activity Stream: label filter should allow excluding specific labels
"Length of stream must be greater than 0." error when pasting images

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting a page with the JIRA Issues Calendar Gadget, the calendar is not rendered properly. Instead of the calendar, the PDF contains the HTML code with the <a> tag and the reference for the gadget.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 6.0.3
 * JIRA 7.0.3, Issues Calendar gadget 4.0.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the JIRA Issues Calendar to a Confluence page
 # Confirm that the gadget is correctly rendered on the page, as follows:
 #            !Screen Shot 2017-01-13 at 12.21.19 PM.png|width=154,height=151,thumbnail!
 # Export page to PDF

h3. Expected Results

The calendar is rendered in the exported PDF as it is in the Confluence page.
h3. Actual Results

The calendar is not rendered and the HTML code with the <a> tag is shown instead (refer to attached PDF).
h3. Notes

This issue also affects other gadgets like the Dataplane Report from Arsenale.
h3. Workaround

No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Export to PDF does not render JIRA Issues Calendar properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The XML-RPC call _getBlogEntry_ should not throw an exception if we are requesting a Page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence with XML-RPC Enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence
# Create a blog in Confluence
# Get the page IDs of both the page and the blog (Edit the page/blog and copy the ID from the URL)
# Run an XML-RPC call _getBlogEntry_ with the blog ID -> Content of the blog is returned
# Run an XML-RPC call _getBlogEntry_ with the page ID

h3. Expected Results
Payload returns a message that the requested ID is a page and not a blog

h3. Actual Results
Confluence throws a ClassCastException with a message that it could not cast a Page object to a BlogPost object
fields.summary: XML-RPC call getBlogEntry should not throw an exception if we are requesting a Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence XML-RPC function getBlogEntry does not always return the full exception message if the ID requested is a page
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence
 # Enable XML-RPC from *Administration* -> *Further Configuration*
 # Send multiple requests for _getBlogEntry_

h3. Expected Results

Every time Confluence will reply with the below error
{code:java}
<Fault 0: 'java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.pages.BlogPost'>
{code}
h3. Actual Results

After multiple attempts, the returned error looks like this:
{code:java}
<?xml version="1.0"?><methodResponse><fault><value><struct><member><name>faultString</name><value>java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException</value></member><member><name>faultCode</name><value><int>0</int></value></member></struct></value></fault></methodResponse>
{code}
(!) Note the difference:
 java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException
 java.lang.Exception: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page cannot be cast to com.atlassian.confluence.pages.BlogPost
h3. Workaround
 * The problem on the Confluence side is caused due to JVM does JIT optimisation and suppresses stack-trace for frequent errors.
 * Restart of the Confluence temporary solves the problem.
 * Disable JIT optimization in Confluence, add to JVM parameter:
{code:java}
-XX:-OmitStackTraceInFastThrow
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence getBlogEntry does not always return the full exception message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45758].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Cutting and pasting a table with shortcuts doesn't work correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Create a table in the page
 # Put some characters in the table
 # Cut *the whole table* with the shortcut {{Cmd + X}} (or {{Ctrl + X}})
 # Paste the table with the shortcut {{Cmd + V}} (or {{Ctrl + V}})

h3. Expected Results

The cutting and pasting the whole table should work in all [supported browsers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/supported-platforms-207488198.html] as they work collectly without the shortcuts.
h3. Actual Results
 * With using Chrome (Version 55.0.2883.95)
 -- Before cut and paste the table
 !chrome_before.png|thumbnail!
 -- After cut and paste the table
 !chrome_after.png|thumbnail!
 * With using Firefox (Version 50.1.0)
 -- Before cut and paste the table
 !firefox_before.png|thumbnail!
 -- After cut and paste the table
 !firefox_after.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Copy and paste without the shortcuts.
fields.summary: Cutting and pasting a table with shortcuts doesn't work correctly

fields.description:
The login page discloses detailed version information of the application to unauthenticated users.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This information facilitates finding vulnerabilities for possible attackers

suggestion: Remove the build number completely in the login page
fields.summary: The Confluence Login page should not gives details of build version to unauthenticated users

fields.description:
When clicking start-confluence.bat or startup.bat, the command window disappears immediately. 

If I use "catalina.bat run", the error message is something like:
{code:java}
C:\Atlassian\Confluence\bin>catalina.bat run
3 周五./0./1_ 8.18.18
30周五.-0.-1_08.18.18
If you encounter issues starting up Confluence, please see the Installation guid
e at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Installation+Guide
Using CATALINA_BASE: "C:\Atlassian\Confluence"
Using CATALINA_HOME: "C:\Atlassian\Confluence"
Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: "C:\Atlassian\Confluence\temp"
Using JRE_HOME: "C:\Atlassian\Confluence\jre"
Using CLASSPATH: "C:\Atlassian\Confluence\bin\bootstrap.jar;C:\Atlassian\C
onfluence\bin\tomcat-juli.jar"
Invalid file name for use with -Xloggc: Filename can only contain the characters
[A-Z][a-z][0-9]-_.%[p|t] but it has been C:\Atlassian\Confluence\bin\..\logs\gc
-30周五.-0.-1_08.18.18.log
Note %p or %t can only be used once
Error: Could not create the Java Virtual Machine.
Error: A fatal exception has occurred. Program will exit.
{code}
It looks in setenv.bat confluence is trying to specify gc log file name based on timestamp with Chinese characters, which is not accepted by the start command. 
{code:java}
set atlassian_timestamp=%DATE:~-4%.%DATE:~4,2%.%DATE:~7,2%_%TIME:~0,2%.%TIME:~3,2%.%TIME:~6,2%
echo %atlassian_timestamp%
...

set CATALINA_OPTS=-Xloggc:"%atlassian_logsdir%\gc-%atlassian_timestamp%.log" %CATALINA_OPTS%
set CATALINA_OPTS=-XX:G1ReservePercent=20 %CATALINA_OPTS%
{code}
 

h3. Workaround
Edit setenv.bat and alter this line:
{code}set CATALINA_OPTS=-Xloggc:"%atlassian_logsdir%\gc-%atlassian_timestamp%.log" %CATALINA_OPTS%{code}

To:
{code}set CATALINA_OPTS=-Xloggc:"%atlassian_logsdir%\gc.log" %CATALINA_OPTS%{code}

Be aware that the log files will overwrite on startup with this configuration, because the filename will no longer contain a unique timestamp. If you need to look at the gc logs, be sure to copy them before restarting the application.
fields.summary: Can not start confluence server in windows8 with Chinese locale

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There needs to be a quick and easy way to delete multiple pages in Confluence. When you have 500 or more pages to delete and you need  to edit and then delete each one separately. This is very problematic!
h3. Suggested solution
From a parent, you should be able to select via checkbox which pages you  want to delete and delete them with one click. Since this have been released for Confluence Server, is there a way to release this for Confluence Cloud?

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"Error retrieving attachments from Confluence. The server may be unavailable." happens when uploading a large size animation gif file into a page.
 And there is no image thumbnail　in the dialog.

!error.png!

There is an error message in atlassian-confluence.log.
{code:java}
2017-01-11 07:39:00,948 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-7] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: 4096
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/pages/editpage.action?pageId=1212418 | url: /rest/prototype/1/content/1212418/attachments.json | traceId: 50117f401c6098e5 | userName: admin
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 4096
	at com.sun.imageio.plugins.gif.GIFImageReader.read(GIFImageReader.java:984)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.renderer.StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator$StreamingImageRenderer.scaleDown(StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.renderer.StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator$StreamingImageRenderer.renderThumbnail(StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.renderer.StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator.lambda$getInputStreamConsumer$0(StreamRendererThumbnailGenerator.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.renderer.ThumbnailRenderer.withStreamConsumer(ThumbnailRenderer.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.renderer.AbstractStreamedThumbnailGenerator.generate(AbstractStreamedThumbnailGenerator.java:14)
    ...
{code}
h3. Environment
 * Checked Confluence 5.10 and 6.0
 * Browser Chrome, Safari and Firefox (OSX)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page
 # Press insert "Image and file icon" (cmd + M)
 # Press Upload files button
 # Select a large size animation gif image (approximately 10 MB)
 # Not complete uploading image.
 # Press close
 # Press insert "Image and file icon" (cmd + M)
 # Error message and no thumbnail

h3. Expected Results

No error message and display image thumbnail.
h3. Actual Results

Error message "Error retrieving attachments from Confluence. The server may be unavailable." and no image thumbnail.
h3. Workaround

no workaround at this moment
fields.summary: "Error retrieving attachments from Confluence. The server may be unavailable." happens when uploading a large size animation gif file into a page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Continuous usage of Collaborative Editing combined with huge number of content and huge number of users in Confluence will result in Slow loading time when editing a page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Collaborative Editing turned on
 # Have a huge number of content in Confluence - after some time of Real Time usage
 # Edit a page

h3. Expected Results

Page can be edited immediately
h3. Actual Results

There's a loading time before we can edit a page.
h4. Workaround

This workaround is for MySQL, as the problem seems to only be exhibited for MySQL databases.

A potential cause is missing indexes. Check that the correct indexes exist for the {{EVENTS}} table:
||Table||Non_unique||Key_name||Seq_in_index||Column_name||Collation||Cardinality||Sub_part||Packed||Null||Index_type||Comment||Index_comment||
|EVENTS|0|PRIMARY|1|rev|A|22468|NULL|NULL| |BTREE| | |
|EVENTS|0|PRIMARY|2|history|A|22468|NULL|NULL| |BTREE| | |
|EVENTS|0|e_h_r_idx|1|rev|A|22468|NULL|NULL| |BTREE| | |
|EVENTS|0|e_h_r_idx|2|history|A|22468|NULL|NULL| |BTREE| | |
|*EVENTS*|*0*|*e_h_p_s_idx*|*1*|*history*|*A*|*22468*|*NULL*|*NULL*| ** |*BTREE*| ** | ** |
|*EVENTS*|*0*|*e_h_p_s_idx*|*2*|*partition*|*A*|*22468*|*NULL*|*NULL*| ** |*BTREE*| ** | ** |
|*EVENTS*|*0*|*e_h_p_s_idx*|*3*|*sequence*|*A*|*22468*|*NULL*|*NULL*| ** |*BTREE*| ** | ** |

If the above bolded index is missing, it can be manually re-created by:
{code:java}
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX e_h_p_s_idx ON EVENTS (`history`, `partition`, `sequence`);{code}
*{color:#333333}_Be aware that a future release of confluence will fix the issue, and any manually added index ought to be removed (when they become redundant)._{color}*
h3. Notes and Research
 * After checking in the database side, Confluence connects to the database to do an SQL "count" query on several database tables, namely "events" table everytime user clicks on "edit page".
 * After continuous usage of Collaborative editing, the above mentioned table (and other tables related to Synchrony and Collaborative editing) has grown so large, than a simple "count" job will take longer.
 * This can be mitigated by following the Documentation [How to reduce the size of Synchrony tables|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+reduce+the+size+of+Synchrony+tables].
 * However, while checking on how many shared drafts will be lost due to this action (instructions provided in this documentation: [How to recover or identify a lost shared draft after disabling collaborative editing in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-recover-or-identify-a-lost-shared-draft-after-disabling-collaborative-editing-in-confluence-858769305.html] shows that there are a huge numbers of shared drafts that will be lost, and not feasible to actually retrieve them one by one.

h3. Real Data feedback from customers:
||Amount of time using Collaborative Editing||Total Spaces||Amount of rows inside the {{EVENTS}} table||Amount of lost shared draft identified||
|1 month|850|650k|8000|
fields.summary: Huge number of content inside Confluence causes Page Editing and Collaborative Editing to load really slow
Allow multiple pages with same names

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce the issue. 
# Create a new page on Confluence with TOC macro with some heading strings or anchor link.
# Save the page. 
# Add the Confluence page gadget on the JIRA instance and show the new created page via the gadget.

h3. Expected behaviour
The link should use the Confluence base URL. 

h3. Actual behaviour 
The link is using JIRA baseURL as the request host.

*Note:* This issue seems affected all macro that using link either implicitly or explicitly on the page
fields.summary: Confluence page gadget pick up the wrong baseURL for TOC or anchor

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Create a new page with table of content. 
# Copy/parse an JIRA issue link to the page and let Confluence render as an JIRA issue macro with one issue.
# Select the JIRA issue macro and apply the heading 2 format.
# Save the page

h3. Expected behaviour
On the page, the table of content macro should render the issue summary with the issue status. 

h3. Actual behaviour
It is showing "Getting issue detail.. " in the summary box and "Status" in the issue status box.
!jira_toc_test.png|thumbnail! 
which is the same as the user did not approve the oauth between JIRA and Confluence.
fields.summary: Table of content failed to load JIRA issue detail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45739].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

If there are projects (Parent Pages) with sub projects (Child Pages), you can't expand or collapse to see the child pages. 

h3. Suggested Solution

If a specific project could be expandable within the view of this project page to show sub project pages associated with the main project (i.e. if child page abc has a parent project page, a "+" sign would be next to the parent project name so that it can expand to show sub projects)

h3. Why this is important
 
It would make the Report even better and organized, since you would be able to see the sub projects(child pages).
fields.summary: Ability to expand and collapse to show Child Pages in Page Property Report
Colors for table cell background and page changes should not be the same

fields.description:
*ENVIRONMENT*

Confluence 5.10.8 running behind Microsoft Web Application Proxy (WAP).

*STEPS TO REPRODUCE*
 # Install Confluence 5.10.8
 # Configure Confluence to run behind Microsoft Web Application Proxy (WAP)
 # Browse the following URL:

{code:java}
<CONFLUENCE_URL>/s/en_GB/5997/6f42626d00e36f53fe51440403446ca61552e2a2.1/5.7.26/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.auiplugin:aui-experimental-iconfont/fonts/atlassian-icons.woff{code}
*EXPECTED RESULT*

Browsing the should prompt the file *{{atlassian-icons.woff}}* download in the browser.

*ACTUAL RESULT*

Browsing the URL produces a Page Not Found 404 error.

*DIAGNOSIS*

This behaviour did not happen in Confluence 5.8.x.

A test on Confluence 5.8.x shows that Confluence is using the the URL below to access the font file:
{code:java}
<CONFLUENCE_URL>/s/en_GB/5997/6f42626d00e36f53fe51440403446ca61552e2a2.1/5.7.26/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.auiplugin:aui-experimental-iconfont/atlassian-icons.woff
{code}
and the WAP normalize the URL to the correct/same URL returning the *atlassian-icons.woff* file.

A test on Confluence 5.10.8 discovered the difference in the path (/fonts) to the *atlassian-icons.woff* file:
{code:java}
http://localhost:8090/s/en_GB/5997/6f42626d00e36f53fe51440403446ca61552e2a2.1/5.7.26/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.auiplugin:aui-experimental-iconfont/fonts/atlassian-icons.woff{code}
and when the WAP normalize the URL, there is a semicolon ":" in the URL which gets translated to a "%3A" which results in a *Page not Found*

*NOTE*

This bug does not affect Confluence running behind Apache and NGINX reverse proxy.
fields.summary: Page Not Found accessing fonts through Microsoft Web Application Proxy

fields.description:
h3. Description
When an application link between confluence and JIRA is created, the "Display in-app notification from other servers" does not show the application.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create an application between confluence and JIRA
# Login in confluence
# Go to In-app Notifications page

*Expected result*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*Actual Result*
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Display in-app notification from other servers option does not appear when a application link is created.
